title: Aditya Sahu set to become Jharkhand BJP president
content: Mr. Sahu will replace Babulal Marandi, who is currently serving as Leader of Opposition in Jharkhand Legislative Assembly

title: Prime Minister Modi to address public meeting in city on Jan. 23
content: The public meeting will be organised in a grand manner, in which AIADMK leaders, including the party general secretary and the NDA‚Äôs Chief Ministerial face Edappadi K. Palaniswami, and leaders from other alliance parties will share the stage with Mr. Modi

title: The UDF‚Äôs ray of hope in an uphill battle in Kerala
content: Kerala local body poll results give the Congress-led United Democratic Front momentum, but Assembly polls could be challenging

title: Mumbai set for high-stakes battle as campaigning for 29 civic body elections ends
content: Roadshows, door-to-door meetings dominate the day ahead of polls tomorrow; all eyes on country‚Äôs richest civic body, BMC; SEC declares polls to 12 zila parishads, 125 panchayat samitis to be held on Feb. 5

title: Tamil Nadu close to eradicating malaria as 33 districts report nil indigenous cases
content: Chennai is among the five districts that are yet to achieve zero transmission, accounting for nearly 37%-45% of the State‚Äôs malaria cases, even as the number has fallen from 173 in 2023 to 121 in 2025

title: Shun the mad race for material assets, develop a spiritual bent of mind: Justice Nagarathna

title: The tussle between the reel and the real in Parasakthi
content: Sudha¬†Kongara‚Äôs¬†film has been criticised by the Congress on the grounds that it misrepresents facts¬†and advances non-existent conspiracies to prop up its narrative

title: Congress accuses BJP of ‚Äòdouble standards‚Äô over its engagement with Communist Party of China
content: Congress demands public disclosure about BJP-CPC closed door meetings; asks whether Chinese military support to Pakistan during Operation Sindoor was discussed

title: TTD introduces QR-based footwear management system at Tirumala
content: Devotees depositing footwear get a QR-coded slip containing details such as number of pairs, size, rack number, box number and exact storage location

title: Kolleru Lake comes alive as winged wonders descend
content: Kolleru Wildlife Sanctuary recorded a total of 96,195 birds belonging to 116 species during the first week of January, says DFO

title: A.P. CM Naidu inaugurates a slew of projects as Sankranti festival begins in his hometown
content: Naidu participates in ground-breaking ceremony of ‚Çπ126.06-crore water project, inaugurates road laid with ‚Çπ77 lakh and a skill development centre built at a cost of ‚Çπ1.4 crore

title:
YSRCP demands White Paper on 
spending on irrigation in Rayalaseema
content: Water Resources Minister Nimmala Ramanaidu‚Äôs assertion that ‚Çπ8,000 crore has been spent on Rayalaseema projects  is far from facts, says Satish Kumar Reddy

title: YSRCP, BRS trying to create discord between A.P. and Telangana: TDP leader
content: The NDA government in Andhra Pradesh believes in resolving inter-State issues through dialogue, says Pattabhiram

title: Send more IPS officers to Centre, Union Home Secretary tells States despite Supreme Court order
content: Top court had directed Centre to ‚Äòprogressively reduce‚Äô deputation of IPS¬†officers in¬†top posts in Central Armed Police Forces

title: Union govt. releases ‚Çπ567.4 crore for healthcare sector in A.P.
content: The funds are part of the ‚Çπ2,600-crore grant allocated by the 15th Finance Commission for the development of the healthcare sector in the State, says Health Minister

title: U.S. tariff threat puts India-Iran ties, BRICS plans under strain
content: Government sources told The Hindu that India is preparing to bring down its trade with Iran further in the current financial year, citing ‚Äúexternal economic factors‚Äù

title: Kuki-Zo groups agree to join Manipur government with a rider
content: They want a written commitment by Centre and State to support their demand for separate administration

title: India-U.S. ties: Jaishankar, Rubio hold phone talks on trade, defence cooperation
content: The phone call came a day after newly-appointed U.S. ambassador Sergio Gor said there will be some contact between the two sides on the trade issue

title: Operation Sindoor ongoing, any misadventure will be dealt with firmly: Army Chief
content: Operation Sindoor was the best example of tri-service synergy under a clear-cut political directive and full freedom to act or respond, said Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi

title: Lok Bhavan announces winners of Governor‚Äôs awards for social service, environmental protection
content: The awardees will receive their awards from the Governor during the ‚ÄòAt Home‚Äô reception on Republic Day at Lok Bhavan, Chennai on January 26

title: Aditya Sahu set to take over as Jharkhand BJP president
content: Mr. Sahu will replace Babulal Marandi, who is currently serving as Leader of Opposition in Jharkhand Legislative Assembly

title: Can Election Commission exclude voters from rolls even before Centre takes a call on citizenship, SC asks
content: Poll body says Article 326, RPA Act, and¬†Registration of Electors Rules of 1960 empower it to conduct an inquisitorial enquiry into citizenship for specific purposes; says persons excluded from the electoral roll under the SIR had the right to appeal

title: Kuki-Zos to hold rally to push for separate administration
content: The tribal community has been demanding a Union Territory as it feels it cannot co-exist with Meiteis in conflict-scarred Manipur

title: WHO asks governments to significantly strengthen taxes on sugary drinks, alcoholic beverages
content: It says weak tax systems are allowing the harmful products to remain cheap while health systems face mounting financial pressure from preventable noncommunicable diseases and injuries

title: 87 more primary health centres to become family health centres
content: The process of transforming PHCs into FHCs has been undertaken in phases by improving physical infrastructure and other facilities, and by creating additional human resources step by step.

title: Congress to launch Kaam Maango Abhiyan to mobilise MGNREGA workers
content: Campaign aims to restore constitutional rights to work and wages; part of nationwide ‚ÄòMGNREGA Bachao Sangram‚Äô movement

title: Telangana procures record 70.82LT paddy produced this Kharif season
content: Value of paddy purchased is over ‚Çπ16,912 cr, farmers paid ‚Çπ16,602 cr so far; Another ‚Çπ1,425 cr provided as bonus to 38.37LT of fine varieties

title: Nipah virus: Health condition of two patients suspected of infection in Bengal remains critical
content: Sources told¬†The Hindu on Tuesday that one of the patients has tested positive for Nipah, and the report for the other patient is awaited

title: Central team assesses damage due to rainfall in excess in Yadgir district
content: Apart from agricultural fields, it visits the Bhima river bridge on the outskirts of Yadgir city and also, the Gursunagi Bridge-cum-Barrage

title: Freight train carrying fuel catches minor fire
content: The fire appeared to have occurred when a crow was electrocuted by the overhead electric line and fell onto the wagon when the train was approaching Thiruvananthapuram

title: Central team reviews flood damage in Kamalapur of Kalaburagi district
content: It assesses crop and infrastructure damage caused by heavy rain in August and September last year and hears grievances of farmers

title: Gandikota Festival sees heavy footfall on concluding day
content: Food kiosks offering mouth-watering local delicacies from Rayalaseema, known for its spicy palate, along with boat rides on the River Penna passing through the gorge formed between the Yerramala hills, were crowd favourites

title: Tomlin ends 19-year run as Steelers head coach
content: Mike Tomlin has stepped down as Steelers coach, ending a 19-year run in Pittsburgh during which he never had a losing season.

title: Tomlin is out as head coach; what's next for Steelers?
content: Who could replace Tomlin, how does this impact Aaron Rodgers and the QB position, and more questions.

title: Sources: AD out several months for hand surgery
content: Anthony Davis is expected to have surgery to repair ligament damage in his left hand and miss the next several months, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: D-backs acquire Arenado in trade with Cardinals
content: The Diamondbacks acquired third baseman Nolan Arenado in a trade with St. Louis, concluding the Cardinals' year-plus-long effort to deal the eight-time All-Star.

title: Bolts fire OC Roman, OL coach after playoff exit
content: The Chargers have fired offensive coordinator Greg Roman and offensive line coach Mike Devlin after their playoff exit, the team announced Tuesday.

title: Vikings' Addison arrested; 3rd incident since '23
content: Vikings receiver Jordan Addison was arrested early Monday morning and charged with misdemeanor trespassing in Tampa, Florida, according to police records.

title: Man United name Carrick boss until end of season
content: Manchester United have appointed former player Michael Carrick as their head coach until the end of the season, the club confirmed Tuesday.

title: Temple assistant, ex-Cornell coach Courtney dies
content: Temple assistant and ex-Cornell coach Bill Courtney has died at age 55 in what the Owls called a "sudden passing."

title: FBS coaches' vote favors 9-game redshirt rule
content: FBS coaches voted unanimously Tuesday to adjust the redshirt rule to allow players to participate in up to nine games while preserving a full year's eligibility in the sport.

title: Study: Ex-NFL player suicide rates rose in 2010s
content: Suicide rates among former NFL players rose between 2011 and 2019 compared to NBA and MLB players, according to a Harvard study.

title: üèà Best of bowl season: Mascots, mayhem, more
content: Ryan McGee looks back at the wild antics, star turns and emotional times that make the postseason special.

content: Which new names enter Jeremy Woo's updated 2026 NBA mock draft and who slid into the top 30 picks or out of the first round?

content: Could three coaches who were just fired immediately find new NFL teams? With interviews taking place this week, we projected candidates to fill open jobs.

title: Men's: Arizona is the new No. 1 overall seed
content: The Wildcats are always there, always very good, yet somehow leave you wanting more. This could be the year that changes.

title: Women's: Duke rises, UNC falls and Texas still No. 2 overall
content: A five-point defeat at LSU doesn't erase the Longhorns' five Quadrant 1 wins. The SEC has seven teams (!) in the top 16.

content: The architect of the Hurricane offense began his career grinding for a job at Southeastern Louisiana.

content: Let's preview the divisional round matchups. How can each team win next weekend and advance? Here's what to know.

content: With a lot of work still left to do, here's how the 2026 win projections and playoff odds stand today.

content: The Games will be missing one of the sport's top countries. Here's what the group could have looked like had it been competing.

content: Who will win the Premier League and who will be relegated? It's time to predict how the second half of the season finishes.

content: How will LIV Golf react? Will other LIV Golf stars follow Koepka back to the PGA Tour? How much will golf fans see Koepka on the PGA Tour this season?

content: Our early bets for the NFL divisional round, plus spreads, lines, totals and FPI analysis for every game.

title: NASCAR goes back in time by restoring Chase format
content: NASCAR's convoluted Playoff format confused most everyone, so on Monday, it announced it was bringing back the postseason formula from 2004-13.

title: Real Madrid fired Xabi Alonso after 233 days. Where did it all go wrong?
content: Xabi Alonso returned to Real Madrid as a club legend and one of the most sought-after coaches around, but he lasted less than a year. What happened?

content: √Ålvaro Arbeloa was a 'Mourinhista' as a player and has adopted his former boss' mentality and approach.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye summer move for Anderson
content: Manchester City are reportedly looking to sign Nottingham Forest midfielder Elliot Anderson. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Are blockbuster NBA trades actually worth it? We evaluated 14 big deals since 2013
content: As teams shy away from dealing first-rounders, which trades have been the biggest successes and utter failures?

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: McConnell, Watson, Nurkic among top players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Dalton Smith's title win shakes up junior welterweight
content: The crowning of a new WBC champion forces major changes in the 140-pound division. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Beyond airstrike: Trump weighing military, cyber, psychological tools against Iran ‚Äî what‚Äôs on table
content: The US has presented President Trump with expanded military, cyber, and psychological operation options to attack Iran amidst nationwide protests. Potential targets include nuclear and missile sites, with cyber and psychological campaigns aimed at disrupting command structures and state media. While diplomacy remains the first option, the US is escalating pressure through tariffs and considering internet access for citizens.

title: 'Red carpet instead of red eyes': Cong targets BJP over CPC meeting; saffron party hits back
content: A Communist Party of China delegation's visit to New Delhi has ignited a political firestorm, with the Congress and BJP trading barbs over transparency and India's China policy. The BJP defended its formal meeting with the CPC, citing improved bilateral ties, while the Congress demanded full disclosure of engagements and questioned if critical issues were raised.

title: 'A good conversation': EAM speaks with Rubio; discusses India-US trade, defence
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar held a productive discussion with US secretary of state Marco Rubio, covering key bilateral and strategic areas. The conversation included trade, critical minerals, nuclear cooperation, defense, and energy. Both leaders agreed to maintain ongoing communication on these important matters.

title: Trump tours Michigan Ford plant; pushes manufacturing agenda
content: US President Trump visited a Ford assembly line in Michigan to promote his manufacturing agenda amidst voter concerns about jobs and the cost of living. He highlighted economic accomplishments and tariffs, aiming to counter anxieties despite recent election results suggesting voter skepticism. The visit also coincided with shifts in electric vehicle policies.

title: 'Pay your own way': Trump's message to 'big tech; Microsoft first to commit to lower power bills
content: US President Donald Trump has announced Microsoft will implement significant changes this week to prevent American households from bearing the cost of AI data centers' high energy consumption. He emphasized that tech giants must "pay their own way." This comes as rising utility bills are linked to AI infrastructure's massive power demands, with some states seeing substantial price hikes.

title: Amazon's RTO gets stricter: Managers tracking hours; three types of employees under scanner
content: Amazon is now closely monitoring office attendance, tracking not just presence but also exact hours spent by corporate employees. This escalation in surveillance, revealed by an internal document, flags 'Low-Time Badgers' and 'Zero Badgers' who don't meet in-office expectations. The move follows a strict five-day return-to-office mandate, with similar tracking systems emerging at tech rivals like Samsung and Dell.

title: Celina Jaitly says husband served divorce notice on 15th anniversary
content: Celina Jaitly revealed her husband Peter Haag served her divorce papers disguised as an anniversary gift. She has filed a domestic violence case against him and is also seeking help to rescue her brother detained in the UAE. Jaitly claims she is denied contact with her three children despite joint custody.

title: Who is Mike Tomlin‚Äôs wife Kiya Winston? Inside her life, career, and marriage
content: Kiya Winston, wife of Steelers coach Mike Tomlin, has carved her own successful path in fashion. Born in New Jersey, she developed a passion for design early, leading to her own clothing brand, Kiya Tomlin Fashion. She met Mike at William and Mary and married in 1996. Kiya has been a support system throughout Mike Tomlin's successful career.

title: Aussie surf king Taj Burrow faces split rumours months after Maldives trip
content: Surf legend Taj Burrow and model Rebecca Burrow are facing strong rumours that their seven-year marriage is over. The talk began after Rebecca changed her name back to Jobson online. Neither has confirmed a split, but her brief comment to Daily Mail Australia and their quiet public lives have raised questions across Western Australia.

title: Canucks open to trading nearly entire roster after loss to Maple Leafs
content: Following a crushing 5-0 defeat to the Toronto Maple Leafs and a subsequent seven-game losing streak, the Vancouver Canucks are reportedly exploring trade options for nearly every player. Management is open to discussions, aiming to 'renovate' or 'retool' the team. This comes after another loss to the Montreal Canadiens, leaving them at the bottom of the NHL standings.

title: WPL: Two Kaurs and Carey humble Gujarat Giants; steer MI to seven-wicket win
content: Mumbai Indians chased down Gujarat Giants‚Äô target with seven wickets in hand in the sixth match of the Women‚Äôs Premier League 2026 on Tuesday.

title: Iran unrest: Russia condemns US threat; warns of ‚Äòdisastrous consequences‚Äô
content: Russia condemned "subversive external interference" in Iran's internal politics, warning of "disastrous consequences" after US President Donald Trump encouraged protestors. Trump's remarks followed widespread protests in Iran, triggered by economic hardship and fueled by anger over subsidy cuts and rising prices, with significant casualties reported.

title: TJ Watt shows pain as Steelers playoff drought grows
content: The Pittsburgh Steelers suffered a 30‚Äì6 wild-card loss to the Houston Texans, marking their seventh straight playoff defeat. Linebacker T.J. Watt openly shared his frustration, saying he has no answers left. Head coach Mike Tomlin avoided future talk, focusing only on the loss. Pittsburgh has not won a playoff game since the 2016 season.

title: UPSC CSE 2026 notification to be released tomorrow: Prelims on May 24; check registration link
content: The Union Public Service Commission will release the Civil Services Examination 2026 notification tomorrow, January 14, 2026. Aspirants can apply online until February 3, 2026. The preliminary exam is scheduled for May 24, 2026. Successful candidates will proceed to the Mains exam later in the year. This marks a crucial step for aspiring civil servants.

title: 25% tariff threat: Trump‚Äôs Iran move rattles Xi; will it upend US-China truce?
content: US President Trump has threatened a 25% tariff on any nation trading with Iran, potentially jeopardizing the US-China trade truce. This move, aimed at increasing pressure on Tehran amidst internal unrest, could significantly impact China, Iran's largest trading partner, and create complex challenges for India, Japan, South Korea, and Turkey.

title: Kohli set to surpass Sachin, Dravid, Rohit, Rahane; closes in on historic feat
content: Virat Kohli is on the cusp of a new Indian record, aiming for his sixth consecutive ODI fifty-plus score against New Zealand in Rajkot. This remarkable streak places him alongside legends like Tendulkar and Dravid.  With an exceptional recent run, Kohli's form is a major talking point as India seeks to extend their series lead.

title: Maharashtra civic body polls: Campaigning ends, SEC enforces MCC ‚Äî all you need to know
content: Maharashtra gears up for its local body elections, with the State Election Commission announcing the schedule for Zilla Parishad and Panchayat Samiti polls. Voting is set for February 5th, following a Supreme Court-mandated deadline extension. Key dates for nominations, scrutiny, and withdrawals have been released, with counting on February 7th. Special arrangements will ensure accessibility for all voters.

title: Vijay Hazare: Prabhsimran Singh's Punjab crush MP by 183 runs; storm into semis
content: Punjab secured a dominant 183-run victory over Madhya Pradesh to advance to the Vijay Hazare Trophy semifinals. Batting first, Punjab posted a formidable 345/6, led by captain Prabhsimran Singh's 88. In response, Madhya Pradesh was bowled out for 162, with Sanvir Singh taking three wickets.

title: Delhi police constable exam answer key released: Check direct link, objection window details
content: Delhi Police Constable answer key for the 2025-26 exam is out on ssc.gov.in. Candidates can check their provisional answers and response sheets until January 16, 2026. An objection window is also open for candidates to challenge answers. Calculate your estimated score using the provided marking scheme and prepare for the final result.

title: Stranger Things creators accused of using ChatGPT for finale script
content: The Duffer Brothers are facing backlash after screenshots from a 'Stranger Things' documentary appeared to show ChatGPT tabs open during scriptwriting. Fans are alleging AI was used for the finale, leading to widespread disappointment and online uproar. While no official confirmation exists, the images have fueled intense speculation about the show's creative process.

title: India‚Äôs US education boom: How America is cutting off its own talent feed
content: India‚Äôs US education boom has been built on a quiet assumption that OPT will give graduates time to work, earn, and attempt longer-term visas. Now that bridge is being recast in Washington as a loophole followed by proposals that could cut, tax, or time-limit the post-study runway. For Indian students and families, the risk is obvious: Degree stays costly, but the payoff window shrinks.

title: Controversy! Amid Olympic 2036 dreams, Dane blasts India Open conditions - 'Unhealthy'
content: Denmark‚Äôs Mia Blichfeldt again criticised playing conditions at the India Open, saying the move to Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium has not helped. She described the venue as cold, dirty and unhealthy, making warm-up difficult, and urged organisers and the BWF to intervene ahead of the World Championships. Canada‚Äôs Michelle Li and former world champion Ratchanok Intanon also raised concerns over the cold conditions.

title: ‚ÄãHappy Pongal 2026: wishes, messages, cards, greetings, pictures and GIFs
content: South India's joyous Pongal harvest festival, celebrated in mid-January 2026, marks the end of winter and honors nature, farmers, and the Sun. This four-day event emphasizes rejuvenation, gratitude, and community bonding. Modern celebrations blend tradition with digital greetings, sharing wishes, messages, and quotes to spread prosperity and happiness.

title: Precious metals surge: Silver jumps Rs 6,000 to lifetime high; gold hits fresh record
content: Silver prices have reached an unprecedented Rs 2,71,000 per kilogram in Delhi, while gold hit a new high of Rs 1,45,000 per 10 grams. This surge, driven by safe-haven demand amidst global geopolitical tensions, marks significant gains for both precious metals. Investors are now keenly awaiting US inflation data for future market direction.

title: Tragic! Olympic medalist dies in avalanche; won bronze in snowboarding
content: Swiss snowboarding pioneer Ueli Kestenholz, a bronze medalist at the sport's Olympic debut in 1998, has tragically passed away at 50 after being caught in an avalanche. Kestenholz, who also excelled in X-Games, was snowboarding with a friend in the Valais region when the incident occurred. He was later airlifted to hospital.

title: India faces second-highest economic burden due to diabetes; doctor explains growing crisis
content: India faces the second-highest economic burden from diabetes globally, a new study reveals. With 11.4% of the population diabetic and 15.3% prediabetic, experts emphasize that borderline diabetes is reversible. Lifestyle changes, including weight loss and regular exercise, are crucial to prevent progression to type 2 diabetes. Early action offers a chance to alter the health trajectory.

title: US sanctions on Iran to have minimal impact on India, say govt sources - here‚Äôs why
content: India anticipates minimal impact from US tariffs on Iran trade, with government sources highlighting limited exposure.  Exporters confirm compliance with US norms for humanitarian trade, primarily food and pharmaceuticals, suggesting no adverse effects.  However, currency depreciation poses a greater concern for Indian businesses.

title: WEF 2026: Trump to attend with the largest-ever US delegation; strong Indian side also expected
content: US President Donald Trump will lead a large delegation to the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, starting January 18. Global leaders will convene amidst rising geopolitical tensions and economic uncertainty, with a focus on Ukraine, Gaza, and Latin America. India will also have a significant presence with ministers and over 100 CEOs.

title: Budget 2026: Will old income tax regime be discontinued leaving new regime as the only option?
content: Budget 2026 income tax expectations: Will the old income tax regime be eventually phased out by the government? With increasing push for the new income tax regime, and higher adoption, we ask experts if the old regime be discontinued:

title: Saudi Money, Pak Nukes, Turkish Military: India Takes Note Of 'Islamic NATO'
content: Turkey is in talks to become part of a Saudi Arabia-Pakistan security arrangement that resembles NATO's collective defence framework.

title: Noted Kerala Educationist Majeed Khan Dies At 91
content: Noted educationist Dr A P Majeed Khan died on Tuesday at a private hospital here following age-related ailments.

title: Appointments By Lalu Yadav Not Part Of His Duty: CBI In Land-For-Jobs Case
content: Solicitor General S V Raju, appearing for the CBI, submitted this before Justice Ravinder Dudeja to argue that there was no need to obtain prior sanction under section 17A of the Prevention of Corruption Act to proceed against Lalu Prasad.

title: BJP Won't Allow Bengal Polls If SIR Process Obstructed: State Party Chief
content: West Bengal BJP president Samik Bhattacharyya said that the party would not allow the upcoming elections to be held in the state, if the party's claims and objections regarding the published draft voters' list in the SIR were not honoured.

title: Trump's "Help On Its Way" Message To Iran Protesters, Then A Russia Warning
content: Russia, in a stern warning to the US, said that the threats of new military strikes on Iran were "categorically unacceptable" and slammed what it called a "subversive external interference" in Tehran's internal politics.

title: Poll Consultant Searched By Cops, Ajit Pawar Says "Don't Spread Rumours"
content: Nationalist Congress Party's Naresh Arora and his election consultancy firm 'DesignBoxed' were searched today, posted party chief and Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on social media platform X today.

title: S Jaishankar, Marco Rubio Hold Phone Talks On Trade, Defence
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday held a phone conversation with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, focusing on cooperation in areas of trade, critical minerals, nuclear energy and defence.

title: "We Choose Denmark": Greenland PM Ahead Of Talks With Vance, Rubio
content: Greenland would choose to remain Danish over a US takeover, its leader said Tuesday, ahead of crunch White House talks on the future of the Arctic island which President Donald Trump has repeatedly threatened.

title: Meat Truck Seized In Bhopal, Massive Row After Lab Confirms Presence Of Beef
content: Bhopal is witnessing a massive row where politics, policing and the municipal system have all landed in the dock over one explosive question: How did a truck carrying 26 tonnes of meat roll out of the city's "modern slaughterhouse" network.

title: BJP Slams Congress For "Prioritising" Rahul Gandhi Over German Chancellor
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar's decision to welcome Congress MP Rahul Gandhi at the Mysuru airport and deputise a minister to receive German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has been panned by the BJP.

title: Congress Leader Digvijaya Singh Says "Vacating" Rajya Sabha Seat
content: Veteran Congress leader and former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Digvijaya Singh on Tuesday announced that he will not seek a third term in the Rajya Sabha. His current six-year tenure is set to expire on April 9, 2026.

title: Bengaluru-Paris Flight Diverted To Turkmenistan After Aircraft Engine Issue
content: An Air France flight from Bengaluru to Paris was diverted to Turkmenistan on Tuesday early morning due to an engine issue with the aircraft.

title: Telangana Panchayat Kills 500 Dogs In A Week To Fulfil 'Election Promise'
content: In a fresh incident of stray dog killings, around 200 canines were allegedly killed in Telangana's Kamareddy district, taking the toll to about 500 in the last one week, police said on Tuesday.

title: As Vijay's Electoral Debut Reshapes Contest, DMK Rolls Out Manifesto Drive
content: The DMK has set the stage for its 2026 Assembly election campaign by constituting a manifesto drafting committee that will tour all districts of Tamil Nadu to gather inputs from the public, organisations and trade bodies.

title: "Minimal Impact On India": Centre On Trump's 25% Tariff On Iran Partners
content: India's commercial exposure to Iran is marginal, and therefore it is unlikely to face any meaningful fallout from the latest US tariff action, government sources said on Tuesday.

title: How Delcy Rodriguez Is Running Venezuela Under Trump's Watch
content: A small but powerful cabal of political and military officials has long commanded power in Venezuela, supported by a wide network of loyalists and security agencies.

title: US To End Legal Protections For Thousands Of Somalis Nationwide: Report
content: US President Donald Trump's administration is ending temporary protected status for thousands of Somalis in the United States, requiring them to leave by March 17.

title: Trump To Return To Davos Summit With Largest-Ever US Delegation
content: All eyes will be on Donald Trump next week as politicians and business leaders head to the World Economic Forum, wondering how to square the mercurial US leader with the Davos creed of open markets and multilateralism.

title: "Vilifying Indira Gandhi": Youth Congress Leader Seeks Ban On Parasakthi
content: A Congress leader in Tamil Nadu has stepped up the party's attack on the Sivakarthikeyan-starrer Parasakthi and demanded a ban on the film, alleging it distorts historical facts surrounding the anti-Hindi imposition agitations of the 1960s.

title: Two Die After Consuming Sweets From Unclaimed Bag In Madhya Pradesh
content: Two people have died after eating sweets found outside a government office in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara, months after the 24 children in the district died from poisoning after consuming a cough syrup.

title: Ladakh suspends Chaddar trek as Zanskar river starts unfreezing
content: a committee found the river had begun to unfreeze, making one of India's most challenging winter treks hazardous . no trekking or allied adventure activity will be permitted on the route during the suspension period . the trek was scheduled to begin on January 10 .

title: Isro's failed PSLV-C62 mission: Spanish satellite survives, transmits data for over 3 minutes
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines ‚Äî Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few ‚Äî  but is based out of Bengaluru, India‚Äôs science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. title: Sankranti, Lohri, Bihu and beyond: Tracing the harvest celebrations of India
content: mid-January marks the easing of winter, the completion of harvest cycles, and the promise of longer days ahead . it is also among the earliest major festival periods of the year, arriving with near-universal observance but strikingly different expressions . the dates are broadly shared across the nation, but each state and region interprets the season through its own rituals and memories .

title: PIOs illegally selling British work visas exposed in sting operation
content: the daily mail said its undercover investigation found an Indian-origin woman selling work visas on facebook Marketplace using forged documents . the woman said she can sell him a skilled worker visa for ¬£12,000 upwards and he had two options, "with job and without job" she said she took a ¬£1,000 cut and offered to arrange a global talent visa for a fee of ¬£1,000 .

title: Gunshots heard during search op in Kathua; drones spotted in Rajouri
content: the area lies near Kamadh Nallah in Kahog forest belt, where an encounter had erupted on Jan 7 . two "drone-like objects" were spotted hovering over a village in Rajouri district . the cordon was fortified while troops continued hunting the ultras .

title: Orioles to debut Tupac Shakur bobblehead against Athletics
content: a prominent figure on the west coast rap scene, the legendary rapper moved to Baltimore from the Bronx in 1985 . he went to middle school and high school in Baltimore before moving to Marin City, Calif. in 1988 . on may 8th, we're celebrating the life and legacy of legendary rapper and actor Tupac Shakur .

title: SC cites Manusmriti, offers widowed daughter-in-law relief
content: daughter-in-law becomes widow after husband's death . she is entitled to claim maintenance from his estate under the Hindu Adoptions and Maintenance Act, 1956 . confusion arose as it was contended that a daughter in-law was entitled to maintenance but not in the case where she became widow .

title: Karur stampede: CBI summons Vijay again on Jan 19; TVK calls BJP 'ideological foe'
content: cbi has issued a notice to televisionK president Vijay asking him to appear again for an inquiry in the Karur stampede case on January 19 . he returned to Chennai on Tuesday . the agency has sought his presence for another round of questioning, but Vijai requested an exemption, citing Pongal festival .

title: Trump urges Iranians to revolt, pledging help
content: the supremo directly encouraged a public uprising in Iran after imposing a blanket 25 per cent tariff on any country that continues to do business with the Islamic Republic . he posted on social media amid reports of a bloodbath in Iran following a crackdown on protests, unapologetically wading into Iranian internal affairs .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks remain Super Bowl favorites; Patriots now AFC front-runner
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the  Super Bowl . The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams , who advanced to the divisional round with a win on Saturday.  The  New England Patriots  and  Buffalo Bills  are now the top two favorites in the AFC after advancing to the Divisional round on Sunday. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the fifth-best odds to win the Super Bowl despite being the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, had a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Supreme Court live updates: Cases on transgender athlete bans
content: The transgender athlete debate has come to the nation's highest court. On Tuesday, for the first time, the U.S. Supreme Court will hear oral arguments on whether transgender girls and women should be eligible for girls' and women's sports. The court will hear two cases. First up is Little v. Hecox, a case rooted in Idaho, which passed the first law restricting transgender girls and women in sports in 2020. In the afternoon, the court will hear arguments in West Virginia v. B.P.J., a case that involves a transgender girl named Becky Pepper-Jackson who competes in track and cross country at her high school. ESPN reporters Katie Barnes and Shwetha Surendran will have live coverage, from inside and outside the courtroom, all day.
